resources.string: What do you want to do?
Huge water fountain there are seasonal shows featuring synchronized water, light and music
The Gothic town hall built from the 13th century is one of the main landmarks of the city
13th-century place of Catholic worship, dedicated to St John the Baptist, reconstructed after WWII
The oldest part of the city. It was formerly an island between branches of the Oder River
The highest building in the city with viewpoint at the top
A medieval market square in the city center, now the heart of a pedestrian zone
Japanese-style garden with a tea pavilion, carp-filled pond and an array of plants and flowers
The oldest zoo in Poland keeping thousands of animals, with focus on conserving endangered species
A monumental cycloramic painting depicting the Battle of Raclawice, during the Kosciuszko Uprising
Center of knowledge about water, where diverse multimedia technologies show water from various fascinating perspectives
The only architecture museum in Poland, founded in 1965. Based in former medieval monastery housing
Established in 1947, holds one of the largest collections of contemporary art in the country
Wrocław history exhibits housed in the former palace, with recreated royal apartments and a garden
A science center offering an interactive exhibition with multimedia elements dedicated to the human and environment
Museum in the main university building, the Baroque edifice of Krzysztof Tausch, located on the banks of the Oder River
Old cars and motorcycles collection located in castle Topacz for automotive lovers
Cozy place, very good service and talk with the chef. Fantastic sense of mixing tastes and flavours
You can eat great Italian Pizza there with a good choice of ingredients
Located in the Market Square. Polish and Czech menu, offering traditional dishes and excellent local beers
Located in the city center, a modern restaurant with a quiet ambient. Modern reinterpretation of traditional dishes
Famous burger place on the map of the city. It started from a small foodtrack.
In Osiem Misek one can choose from a couple of dishes, including spring rolls, pad thai and steamed buns. Some yerba mate, tea and "healthy" lemonades to it
A hard rock cafe style bar and restaurant in the main square. The food is mainly steak and burgers and the drinks are mostly Jack Daniels based whisky themed
The menu is limited and the food freshly prepared from high quality ingredients. The interior is charming, with moody lights and intimate atmosphere
T-Mobile New Horizons International Film Festival
Every Sunday and Wednesday in Browar Mieszczański. It is a place where you can fill your basket with delicious and healthy products, from traditional ones to those that are rare
It is an international film festival held annually in July in Wrocław. It has been organised since 2001. It is one of the biggest and most popular film festivals in Poland
A place where you can have a relaxing session in a deckchair on a green terrace to wind down in a leafy setting to the sounds of specially arranged music from the Capitol own stage productions

It is a globally recognised jazz event which offers première performances commissioned specifically by the festival and numerous projects that help emerging jazz artists show their skills at larger audiences
One of the most important classical music festival in Europe. Years ago, the festival was the only opportunity to meet the world-famous artists behind the Iron Curtain

Artists from all over the world are invited to present their traditions. The festival is an opportunity for attendees to speak about where they come from, their values, their tradition and their spirituality
